decks.notes: The deck focuses on creating a powerful Elf tribal synergy, utilizing mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Heritage Druid to generate mana quickly. The key strategy is to ramp up mana production to cast high-cost Elves like Ezuri, Renegade Leader and Elvish Archdruid. Collected Company and Chord of Calling are crucial for finding key creatures like Shaman of the Pack to deal damage directly to the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient Elf combo, utilizing cards like Nettle Sentinel and Dwynen's Elite to create a powerful board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly lower your life total to strengthen Death's Shadow while disrupting your opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. By efficiently filling your graveyard with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Thought Scour, you can also power out large threats like Gurmag Angler. Using a mix of removal spells and counter magic, you aim to control the game while applying consistent pressure with your aggressive creatures, ultimately overwhelming your opponent before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using Krark-Clan Ironworks to generate mana by sacrificing artifacts and then looping them with Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever. By recurring artifacts like Terrarion, Ichor Wellspring, and Chromatic Star, the deck aims to draw cards and generate enough mana to eventually win the game through Aetherflux Reservoir. The deck also includes cards like Engineered Explosives and Pyrite Spellbomb for removal and additional ways to generate value. The deck seeks to efficiently assemble its combo pieces and create a powerful storm turn to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to quickly ramp up mana and control the game through a mix of counter spells, removal, and powerful finishers like Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also includes versatile cards like Expedition Map and Thirst for Knowledge to ensure consistency in assembling the UrzaTron lands. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent with powerful threats and control elements.

The key concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck also utilizes removal spells and versatile planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to control the board and protect its threats. Additionally, the deck includes graveyard hate and card advantage engines to maintain tempo and outvalue the opponent in the mid to late game.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of low-cost spells and aggressive creatures. Utilizing discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while generating value with cards like Faithless Looting and Young Pyromancer. Bedlam Reveler is used as a powerful finisher, refilling the hand and providing a big threat. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Kolaghan's Command adds versatility and disruption to the deck's strategy. Overall, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's plans to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with artifact creatures and equipment, using cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to pump up creatures and deal damage. The deck also includes cards like Galvanic Blast for direct damage to the opponent and Arcbound Ravager for sacrifice synergy. The inclusion of Karn, Scion of Urza adds versatility and card advantage to the deck. The goal of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive plays utilizing the synergy between artifacts and creatures.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. By utilizing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel, as well as powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Lava Spike, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early damage and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Efficient mana base with fetch lands and dual lands helps to consistently cast spells and keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements, such as Blood Moon, Ensnaring Bridge, and Chalice of the Void, to disrupt and control the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes big red creatures like Pia and Kiran Nalaar and Koth of the Hammer to apply pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the deck has efficient removal spells like Abrade and Anger of the Gods to deal with threats. The mana acceleration provided by cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Gemstone Caverns helps the deck to establish a strong board presence quickly.

This aggro deck focuses on aggressively playing out a variety of Human creatures with powerful abilities and synergies. By using cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls to cheat out creatures and provide protection from counterspells, combined with disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly building a board presence with Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant. Restoration Angel provides additional value and evasion, while Mantis Rider offers a fast clock to close out games.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on a strong and aggressive creature base with cards like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Bloodbraid Elf, backed up by disruption and removal spells such as Thoughtseize, Lightning Bolt, and Terminate. The deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with efficient threats and removal spells. Liliana of the Veil and other Planeswalkers provide added value and card advantage, while the land base ensures consistent mana access for the deck's powerful spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures to disrupt your opponent's strategy while also taxing their resources. By playing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter, you can slow down your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with creatures like Restoration Angel and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also includes interaction and disruption through cards like Path to Exile and Eldrazi Displacer, allowing you to control the battlefield and dictate the pace of the game. With a mix of aggro and control elements, this deck aims to outmaneuver and overwhelm your opponent in a Modern setting.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent by utilizing efficient burn spells and fast creatures. This allows the player to control the pace of the game and put pressure on the opponent to respond, while also having the ability to prevent opponent's lifegain with cards like Skullcrack. The deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or gain too much life, resulting in a swift victory.

The main concept of this Aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to deal fast and consistent damage to the opponent by playing efficient burn spells and creatures with haste. By utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to quickly lower the opponent's life total before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel adds additional pressure on the opponent, punishing them for casting spells. Overall, the deck prioritizes speed and aggression to win the game as quickly as possible.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with small artifact creatures and using cards like Arcbound Ravager and Cranial Plating to pump them up for lethal attacks. Steel Overseer and Signal Pest help to boost the power of the board while Karn, Scion of Urza provides card advantage. The deck also includes removal in the form of Galvanic Blast and protection with Welding Jar. The mana base is streamlined with artifact lands and Mox Opal for acceleration. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of the deck is to generate a high amount of mana quickly through cards like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual, while also benefiting from cost reduction effects from cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer. The deck aims to dig through the library with cards like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand to find key combo pieces like Grapeshot and Past in Flames. Gifts Ungiven is used to tutor for combo pieces as well. The deck focuses on casting a large number of spells in a single turn to create a lethal Grapeshot finish.
